meanings.definition: A person or thing that spoils or ruins something.
meanings.sent1: The rain was a real pooper on our picnic.
meanings.sent2: The spoiled child was always a pooper at the birthday parties.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat became the pooper at the animal shelter event.
meanings.sent4: His negative attitude was a pooper on the team's victory.
meanings.sent5: The broken guitar string was the ultimate pooper during the concert.

meanings.sent1: The baby's diaper needed changing after the little pooper did their business.
meanings.sent2: The pooper flushed the toilet after using it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was caught being a sneaky pooper in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The outdoor pooper left a mess on the hiking trail.
meanings.sent5: The public restroom had a sign reminding each pooper to wash their hands.

meanings.definition: A party pooper; someone who ruins the fun for others.
meanings.sent1: Don't be a pooper and let us enjoy the celebration.
meanings.sent2: The grumpy neighbor was always the pooper at the block party.
meanings.sent3: The tired toddler became the pooper at the playground.
meanings.sent4: Her strict rules made her the pooper at the sleepover.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher was known as the pooper of all class parties.
